Posts.Content: silvergirl9114 wrote: Haven't been on this board in a long time---at four years out I decided it really was time to "move on".  But maybe not so fast.  About 3 weeks ago a found a rather large thickening/lump above my mastectomy side.  It's about 4" below my collar bone and midway between my sternum and shoulder.  Had a clear MRI in January.  Would a mammo/MRI even pick up something that far up? I had a free tram reconstruction but can't imagine why I would find scar tissue at such a late date and why in such a specific spot and so far above the surgical scar.  Does breast tissue even go that far up on our chests?.  Can't even get in to see my surgeon until 7/10---another exercise in finding out how much tension I can take.  For a variety of reasons I don't want to tell anyone in my family yet so you guys will just have to put up with me!  Has anyone had an experience like this?    Live in the moment! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Weird lump high on chest silvergirl9114 silvergirl9114
